alert.note: Alert for Brooks (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 7:20PM CDT until April 25 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Brooks and Jim Hogg. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms occurring across central and northern Brooks and Jim Hogg Counties. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Falfurrias, Agua Nueva, Hebbronville, Encino, Rachal, San Rafael Ranch Airport, El Coyote Ranch Airport, South Fork Estates, Hebbronville High School, Gruy Stadium, Las Lomitas, Falfurrias Junior High School, Falfurrias Fire Station, La Colonia Park, Randado, Pleasant Park, Jim Hogg County Airport, Airport Road Addition, Guerra and Thompsonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
